properties.verseOrder: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: At Boulavogue, as the sun was setting O'er the bright May meadows of Shalmaleer A rebel hand set the heather blazing And brought the neighbors from far and near.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Then Father Murphy, from old Kilcormac, Spurred up the rocks with a warning cry. "Arm, Arm." He cried, "For I've come to lead you For Ireland's freedom we'll fight or die."

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: He leads us on 'gains the coming soldiers, The cowardly yeomen we put to flight. 'Twas at the Hara, the boys of Wexford showed Bougie's regiment old men could fight.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: Look out for hirelings King George of England, Search every Kingdom that breeds a slave For Father Murphy, from County Wexford, Sweeps o'er the land like a mighty wave.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: At Vinegar Hill o'er the Pleasant Slane, Our heroes bravely stood back to back. And the Youls at Tulla took Father Murphy And burned his body upon the rack.

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: God grant you glory Father Murphy And open heaven to all your men, For the cause that called you, May call tomorrow in another fight for the green again.
